description.value: Logical model describing the model for the prescription referral. This draft is used in the HL7 Belgian workgroup for referral.

definition.value: Logical model describing the model for the prescription referral. This draft is used in the HL7 Belgian workgroup for referral.

short.value: When this prescription was created

definition.value: When this prescription was created

short.value: The person who is responsable for the content, not necessarily the person who entered the content. This is either the prescriber, a co-prescriber or a performer. It is the last person who updated the resources.

definition.value: The person who is responsable for the content, not necessarily the person who entered the content. This is either the prescriber, a co-prescriber or a performer. It is the last person who updated the resources.

short.value: The prescribing healthcare party

definition.value: The prescribing healthcare party

short.value: Number of co-prescribers that must sign the prescription to activate it

definition.value: Number of co-prescribers that must sign the prescription to activate it

short.value: Information about co prescribers

definition.value: Information about co prescribers

human.value: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

short.value: Unique id for inter-element referencing

definition.value: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

description.value: Extensions are always sliced by (at least) url

short.value: Additional content defined by implementations

definition.value: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.

comment.value: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions. The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

human.value: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

short.value: Extensions that cannot be ignored even if unrecognized

definition.value:
May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element and that modifies the understanding of the element in which it is contained and/or the understanding of the containing element's descendants. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions.
Modifier extensions SHALL NOT change the meaning of any elements on Resource or DomainResource (including cannot change the meaning of modifierExtension itself).

comment.value: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions. The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

requirements.value: Modifier extensions allow for extensions that *cannot* be safely ignored to be clearly distinguished from the vast majority of extensions which can be safely ignored. This promotes interoperability by eliminating the need for implementers to prohibit the presence of extensions. For further information, see the [definition of modifier extensions](http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/extensibility.html#modifierExtension).

human.value: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

isModifierReason.value: Modifier extensions are expected to modify the meaning or interpretation of the element that contains them

short.value: The co-prescriber party

definition.value: The co-prescriber party

short.value: Type of the practitioner

definition.value: Type of the practitioner

short.value: Status of co prescribing status (to sign, signed or refused)

definition.value: Status of co prescribing status (to sign, signed or refused)

short.value: Type of mandatory for the signature of the co-prescriber (1= required: the co-prescriber SHALL sign to make the prescription valid, 2= conditionally required: the co-prescriber SHALL sign if the number of co-prescribers with a signature is lower than the number in co-prescriber number 3= optional: the signature does not affect the validity of the prescription, but is for information only

definition.value: Type of mandatory for the signature of the co-prescriber (1= required: the co-prescriber SHALL sign to make the prescription valid, 2= conditionally required: the co-prescriber SHALL sign if the number of co-prescribers with a signature is lower than the number in co-prescriber number 3= optional: the signature does not affect the validity of the prescription, but is for information only

short.value: The SSIN of the person for which the referral is prescribed.

definition.value: The SSIN of the person for which the referral is prescribed.

short.value: An identifier for the ReferralPrescription, e.g. the UHMEP identifier, once available

definition.value: An identifier for the ReferralPrescription, e.g. the UHMEP identifier, once available

short.value: An identifier for the Prescription Search Support

definition.value: An identifier for the Prescription Search Support

short.value: Reason for not following the PSS suggestion

definition.value: Reason for not following the PSS suggestion

short.value: An identifier for the bundle this prescription belongs to.
The original request or prescription triggered this prescription

definition.value: The original request or prescription that is the reason for this request - for example when a detailed request is created by a broader request.

short.value: Period of validity of prescription

definition.value: Period of validity of prescription

short.value: When this prescription is executed, available after start of execution

definition.value: When this prescription is executed, available after start of execution

short.value: The latest moment to end this treatment

definition.value: The latest moment to end this treatment

short.value: The prescription must have left the draft status before

definition.value: The prescription must have left the draft status before

short.value: The intended provider, i.e. who is expected to perform the procedure - a specific person or a speciality

definition.value: The intended provider, i.e. who is expected to perform the procedure - a specific person or a speciality
